data.title: Trump vs Harris live: Harris raises $12m in California fundraiser as Elon Musk to interview Trump live on X
data.meta_description: Latest 2024 election news as Kamala Harris raises $12m in California fundraiser and Elon Musk to interview Trump
data.text:
Democratic presidential contender Kamala Harris picks up huge haul in home state as Donald Trump prepares for sitdown with tech entrepreneur Elon Musk

Democratic presidential contender Kamala Harris raised $12m from a high-profile fundraiser in her home state of California on Sunday after concluding her tour of the swing states with new running mate Tim Walz in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Joined by former House speaker Nancy Pelosi and state governor Gavin Newsom for the event in a hotel ballroom in San Francisco, Harris told her audience, “It’s good to be home,” before warning that healthcare, abortion access and LGBT+ rights would all be placed under threat in a second Donald Trump presidency.

“We know what we need to do – we need to knock on doors, we need to register folks to vote, we need to get people to the polls. And every day matters,” she said.

“That’s why we’re going to win, but let’s not take anything for granted.”

Her Republican rival is meanwhile preparing for a live interview on X on Monday evening with the tech entrepreneur Elon Musk as he continues to gripe about Harris’s campaign while scheduling only a fraction of the campaign events the Democratic ticket is engaging in.

Trump’s running mate, JD Vance, meanwhile remains under fire over his “childless cat lady” comments.

1723455917

Truth Social: Trump gripes about election and attempts to take credit for 2028 Olympics

The former president continues to whine on social media about his electoral plight, much as he did during last week’s live meltdown from Mar-a-Lago.

To freshen things up, he’s also been busy attempting to take credit for Los Angeles securing the next Olympic Games, having no doubt been watching the closing ceremony in Paris on TV at the time.

You know what might lighten the mood Don?

Doing some actual campaigning.

Joe Sommerlad12 August 2024 10:45

1723454117

Weekend rally highlights: Harris in Vegas vs Trump in Montana

Here’s a study in contrasts.

Harris took the fight to Trump in the desert gambling Mecca...

...while the Republican continued to flail desperately in his attacks on the Democrat and her running mate Tim Walz and spent time fat-shaming local senator Jon Tester.

More?

Here’s Oliver O’Connell on Trump’s bizarre claim that nobody knows Kamala Harris’s surname.

Er, it’s Harris.

Trump oddly claims during Montana rally no one knows Kamala Harris’s last name

Former president Donald Trump continues trying out new attack lines on Kamala Harris as she surges in polls

Joe Sommerlad12 August 2024 10:15

1723452317

Elon Musk to interview Donald Trump live on X

Tech billionaire Elon Musk will interview Donald Trump on X today at 8pm ET.

Musk, who officially endorsed the Republican presidential nominee last month, said the interview would be “unscripted witht no limits on subject matter”, adding that the exchange “should be highly entertaining.”

Keen to banish the spectre of Florida Governor Ron DeSantis’s disastrous campaign launch on his platform, which was ruined by glitches, Musk further added: “Am going to do some system scaling tests tonight and tomorrow in advance of the conversation with Donald Trump.”

Trump last week announced he would sit down for an “INTERVIEW WITH ELON MUSK”, without providing further details.

Joe Sommerlad12 August 2024 09:45

1723450517

Kamala Harris raises $12m at California fundraiser

Good morning!

Democratic presidential contender Kamala Harris raised $12m from a high-profile fundraiser in her home state of California on Sunday after concluding her tour of the swing states with new running mate Tim Walz in Las Vegas, Nevada.

Joined by former House speaker Nancy Pelosi and state governor Gavin Newsom for the event in a hotel ballroom in San Francisco, Harris told her audience, “It’s good to be home,” before warning that healthcare, abortion access and LGBT+ rights would all be placed under threat in a second Donald Trump presidency.

“We know what we need to do – we need to knock on doors, we need to register folks to vote, we need to get people to the polls. And every day matters,” she said.

Introducing the Vice President on stage, Pelosi declared: “This is a good day when we welcome Kamala Harris back home to California. She makes us all so proud, she brings us so much joy, she gives us so much hope.”

Joe Sommerlad12 August 2024 09:15

Why Trump is desperately trying to make Kamala Harris’s laugh a problem

Those who know Harris recognize an old nervous tic. And they also think they know why Trump – a man with ‘no sense of humor’ – hates it so much. Io Dodds reports on a Republican attack line that still won’t stick

Oliver O'Connell12 August 2024 08:45

1723446940

Trump falsely claims Harris used AI to show an inflated crowd

Donald Trump has falsely accused vice president Kamala Harris of using AI to create the illusion of a larger crowd at her last week’s Detroit rally.

“Has anyone noticed that Kamala CHEATED at the airport? There was nobody at the plane, and she ‘A.I.‘d’ it, and showed a massive ‘crowd’ of so-called followers, BUT THEY DIDN’T EXIST!” the Republican presidential nominee wrote on Truth Social yesterday.

Mr Trump’s false remarks were about an image of a large crowd on the tarmac in Michigan cheering for Ms Harris as she stepped out of the Air Force Two on 7 August.

In a following post, he wrote: “EVERYTHING ABOUT KAMALA IS FAKE.”

Ms Harris’s campaign rejected the conspiracy theory, saying that was an “actual photo of a 15,000-person crowd for Harris-Walz in Michigan”.

Alisha Rahaman Sarkar12 August 2024 08:15

1723441500

Trump campaign says it was hacked and had documents stolen

Donald Trump’s campaign said on Saturday that some of its internal communications had been hacked after Politico began receiving emails from an anonymous account that included internal campaign documents.

Citing a Microsoft report published on Friday that Iranian hackers “sent a spear phishing email in June to a high-ranking official on a presidential campaign”, the campaign blamed “foreign sources hostile to the United States.”

In the report, Microsoft did not identify the campaign targeted by the email and declined to comment when approached by Politico.

Trump campaign says it was hacked and documents stolen, pointing the finger at Iran

Campaign cites Microsoft report on Iranian attempts to interfere with 2024 election

Oliver O'Connell12 August 2024 06:45

1723439715

Pelosi welcomes Harris home as she raises $12m

Former House speaker Nancy Pelosi made the case for vice president Kamala Harris’s presidential campaign at a California fundraiser that raked in millions of dollars after a swing state tour for the Democratic candidate.

Ms Pelosi appeared with Ms Harris in San Francisco at an event that her campaign said raised more than $12m (£9.4m).

“This is a good day when we welcome Kamala Harris back home to California,” Ms Pelosi said about the former senator, attorney general and district attorney from the state.

“She makes us all so proud. She brings us so much joy. She gives us so much hope,” Ms Pelosi added.

Ms Harris and her running mate, Minnesota governor Tim Walz, have just finished a tour of multiple political swing states, packing rallies with thousands of people and building on the momentum that has propelled her since she took over at the top of the Democratic ticket.

Alisha Rahaman Sarkar12 August 2024 06:15

1723437900

Trump’s Truth Social lost $16.4 million last quarter

Donald Trump’s social media company Trump Media and Technology Group has reported a $16.4 million loss and less than $1 million in quarterly revenue, only months after it began trading publicly to much fanfare earlier this year.

The parent company of Truth Social said on Friday in its latest filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission that it had earned $837,000 in revenue for the second quarter of 2024 — down 30 percent from the same period last year.

Trump’s Truth Social lost $16.4m last quarter and less than $1m in revenue

Truth Social parent company took hit from legal costs and investment in Truth+ service

Oliver O'Connell12 August 2024 05:45
